text: we finally made it through one of the
craziest elections in American history
but despite how you feel about Donald
Trump's hand size or Hillary's emails
your vote doesn't totally decide who
becomes president for that we turn to
the Electoral College I took a trip back
to college to figure out how this system
works when you go to vote you're
actually voting for representatives in
the electoral college from your state
who will then vote your vote is
affecting which presidential candidate
the members of the electoral college in
your state vote for the structure of the
Electoral College has a big impact on
where candidates go on where they take
out ads but also you know to some extent
what issues they emphasize so the
importance of your vote in this system
depends a whole lot on things that are
completely out of your control like your
state's population or whether your state
tends to always vote for the same party
take a big state like California in 2012
over 4 million Californians voted for
Mitt Romney but it's a winner-take-all
system so President Obama took home all
of the electoral votes in that state and
sometimes the national popular vote and
the electoral college don't agree that's
happened four times in US history most
recently in 2004 won a slight majority
of the popular vote but Bush won a
majority of vote in the electoral
college it's very rare so how did we end
up with this system in the first place
there was a notion that it would be very
bad for the country if you had a
president who could win a majority of
votes in just one section or one region
of the country now there's one final
issue with the electoral college and
it's this possibility of a so-called
faithless elector the electors typically
vote to do whatever the majority of the
voters of the state choose to do in
terms of who they want to be president
now legally they may not be bound to do
that so there's a chance the electors in
your state could just go rogue and vote
for whoever they want and now that we've
gone back to school to teach you about
the Electoral College we want
what you think comment with your
thoughts below and we'll respond to some
